description: Roads of Arabia: Archaeology and History of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Over the last forty years. archaeologists working in Saudi Arabia have been uncovering sites across the peninsula, revealing an ancient past for which there is scant literary testimony and hitherto no tangible evidence. This exhibition, Roads of Arabia, can open all our eyes, as it includes well over three hundred objects that date from prehistoric times to the birth of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in 1932. It offers, then, a window on the peninsula’s pre-Islamic past and on the axis of the entire Muslim community, the Holy Shrine of the Ka`ba in Mecca.
title: Roads of Arabia
title_extended: Roads of Arabia: Archaeology and History of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
